channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Police investigating racial harassment of NCAA women's basketball team in Idaho
item.description: Police are investigating reported harassment of the University of Utah women's basketball team while staying in Coeur D'Alene, Idaho for the NCAA tournament in nearby Spokane, Washington.
item.content:encoded:
Police are investigating reported harassment of the University of Utah women's basketball team while staying in Coeur D'Alene, Idaho for the NCAA tournament in nearby Spokane, Washington.

(Image credit: Steph Chambers)
item.dc:creator: Troy Oppie

item.title: What to do if your vehicle is submerged in water
item.description: The best way to survive a vehicle submersion is to escape through the windows before the car is fully submerged, experts agree.
item.content:encoded:
The best way to survive a vehicle submersion is to escape through the windows before the car is fully submerged, experts agree.

(Image credit: Bryan R. Smith)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Mercedes, GM, Stellantis scramble; Port jobs are at risk after Baltimore disaster
item.description: Baltimore's port isn't one of the nation's largest, and some goods can be rerouted. But some auto companies are having to scramble, and the bridge disaster could spell trouble for local jobs.
item.content:encoded:
Baltimore's port isn't one of the nation's largest, and some goods can be rerouted. But some auto companies are having to scramble, and the bridge disaster could spell trouble for local jobs.

(Image credit: Kena Betancur)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: N.Y. judge issues a limited gag order on Trump ahead of hush money trial
item.description: The new gag order on former President Donald Trump specifically bars him from making public statements about witnesses, prosecutors or jurors in his first criminal trial.
item.content:encoded:
The new gag order on former President Donald Trump specifically bars him from making public statements about witnesses, prosecutors or jurors in his first criminal trial.

(Image credit: Justin Lane)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Conditions in Gaza and Tense Israel-US Relations
item.description:
We hear from a U.N. spokesperson about the conditions for civilians he saw in Gaza. We also speak to an Israeli government minister about the level of humanitarian aid entering Gaza and about why a delegation to the U.S. was cancelled over a vote at the U.N.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.content:encoded:
We hear from a U.N. spokesperson about the conditions for civilians he saw in Gaza. We also speak to an Israeli government minister about the level of humanitarian aid entering Gaza and about why a delegation to the U.S. was cancelled over a vote at the U.N.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Robert Kennedy Jr. taps a wealthy California attorney as his running mate
item.description: Kennedy, who's known for anti-vaccine advocacy and as a promoter of conspiracy theories, picked Nicole Shanahan, a political novice, as his running mate for his independent presidential campaign.
item.content:encoded:
Kennedy, who's known for anti-vaccine advocacy and as a promoter of conspiracy theories, picked Nicole Shanahan, a political novice, as his running mate for his independent presidential campaign.

(Image credit: Eric Risberg)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: How climate-driven migration could change the face of the U.S.
item.description: ProPublica reporter Abrahm Lustgarten says millions of Americans are likely to move in the coming decades to escape wildfires, rising seas, oppressive heat and drought. His new book is On the Move.
item.content:encoded: ProPublica reporter Abrahm Lustgarten says millions of Americans are likely to move in the coming decades to escape wildfires, rising seas, oppressive heat and drought. His new book is On the Move.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Former RNC Chair Ronna McDaniel dropped as an NBC contributor following outcry
item.description: Ronna McDaniel — former head of the RNC and Trump ally — has been dropped by NBC following both internal and public pushback after the network hired her as a paid contributor.
item.content:encoded:
Ronna McDaniel — former head of the RNC and Trump ally — has been dropped by NBC following both internal and public pushback after the network hired her as a paid contributor.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: C Mandler

item.title: Supreme Court seems doubtful of challenge to abortion pill
item.description: At issue in the case is more than abortion rights. It's the entire structure of the FDA's regulatory power to approve drugs and continually evaluate their safety.
item.content:encoded:
At issue in the case is more than abortion rights. It's the entire structure of the FDA's regulatory power to approve drugs and continually evaluate their safety.

(Image credit: Patrick Semansky)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Trump's social media company surges in trading debut in a big boost to Trump's wealth
item.description: Trump Media and Technology Group surged in its trading debut, substantially boosting the former president's wealth — at least on paper.
item.content:encoded:
Trump Media and Technology Group surged in its trading debut, substantially boosting the former president's wealth — at least on paper.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam
